Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as a threat to freedom of expression, opinion, and speech.
The author draws parallels between the proposed legislation and experiences under a tyrannical government.
The legislation contradicts Australia's commitments to international human rights treaties, specifically the ICCPR.
The bill would grant ACMA excessive power over media, leading to potential censorship.
Concerns about Australia moving towards a form of government control akin to communism or tyranny.
Notable Quotes: I was born in and I had firsthand experience of what a tyrannical corrupted dictator government can do to its people...
The Bill cannot be allowed to pass, if it is passed, this would allow ACMA, unilateral and discretionary authority to govern all forms of media.
Freedom is never more than one generation away from extinction.
